title: Dependants of Gaza students can come to UK, government says
description: The decision is a reversal of the original policy which only supported the evacuation of the students themselves.
content:
Partners and children of Gazan students coming to study in the UK will be now able to join them, the government has confirmed.
It marks a reversal of the original policy which only supported the evacuation of the students themselves.
Each application... [3029 chars]

title: Boris Johnson tells Tories to stop ‘bashing green agenda’ or risk losing next election
description: Former PM says he has not seen party ‘soaring in the polls as a result of saying what rubbish net zero is’
content:
Boris Johnson has warned the Conservatives they will not win the next election by “bashing the green agenda”.
The former prime minister said he had not seen the Conservatives “soaring in the polls as a result of saying what rubbish net zero is”.

title: Rachel Reeves admits breaking rules by renting out her house without a licence
description: Chancellor is backed by prime minister after saying she ‘inadvertently’ failed to pay fee required by London council
content:
Rachel Reeves has admitted to “inadvertently” breaking housing rules by renting out her south London home without the specific £945 licence required by the local council.
The chancellor admitted the error to the prime minister, Keir Starmer, and to p... [3003 chars]

title: Thousands on benefits could have energy debt cancelled
description: Regulator Ofgem plans to cut £500m from the stack of customer debt - but other billpayers will cover the cost.
content:
Thousands on benefits could have energy debt cancelled
8 hours ago
Kevin PeacheyCost of living correspondent
Nearly 200,000 people on benefits could have their debts to their energy supplier cancelled, if they make some effort to pay what is owed.

title: Chancellor Rachel Reeves admits breaking housing rules by renting out home
description: Rachel Reeves refers herself to the PM's ethics adviser after "inadvertently" renting out her family home without a licence.
content:
Chancellor Rachel Reeves has admitted breaking housing rules by unlawfully renting out her family home without a licence.
Reeves has told Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer, as well as the independent ethics adviser and Parliament's standards commission... [2436 chars]
